Comment.Language: From the Feast of the Ascension of our Lord to the 49th day of the Pentecost Period:

Text.Language: Hwc e~P[oic qen ouhwc m~beri: caji m~pefw~ou nem nefs~v/ri: P,#c# aftwnf e~bolqen n/eymwout: ouoh afsenaf e~p~swi e~niv/oui.
Sing to the Lord a new song, declare His glory and wonders. Christ is risen from the dead and has ascended into the heavens.

Afi~ n~je P[oic sa B/ya~nia: nem nefmay/t/c eyouab: affai n~nefjij afc~mou e~rwou: afsenaf e~p~swi e~niv/oui.
The Lord came to Bethany, with His Holy Disciples, He raised His Hands and blessed them, He ascended to the heavens.

All/louia (4) Pi,~rictoc aftwnf e~bolqen n/eymwout: ouoh afsenaf e~p~swi e~niv/oui.
Alleluia (4) Christ is risen from the dead and has ascended into the heavens.
